dc_title_s: Transportation Improvement Program, MAGIC Subregion, Boston, Massachusetts, 1999 (Raster Image)
dc_description_s: This layer is a georeferenced raster image of the historic paper map entitled: TIP land use map, MAGIC subregion, Transportation Improvement Program, produced by the Metropolitan Area Planning Council GIS Lab. It was published by Metropolitan Area Planning Council in 1999. Scale [ca. 1:33,500]. Covers the Minuteman Advisory Group on Interlocal Coordination (MAGIC) communities including: Lexington, Bedford, Lincoln, Concord, Acton, Carlisle, Maynard, Hudson, Stow, Boxborough, Littleton, and Bolton, Massachusetts.The image inside the map neatline is georeferenced to the surface of the earth and fit to the Massachusetts State Plane Coordinate System, Mainland Zone (in Feet) (Fipszone 2001). All map collar and inset information is also available as part of the raster image, including any inset maps, profiles, statistical tables, directories, text, illustrations, index maps, legends, or other information associated with the principal map. This map shows features such as drainage, cities and other human settlements, roads, railroads, commuter rails and stations, town boundaries, public institutions, and more. Shows also transportation lines and land use by type including: residential, commercial, industrial, transportation, undeveloped, protected open space, water, and wetland.This layer is part of a selection of digitally scanned and georeferenced historic maps from the Harvard Map Collection. These maps typically portray both natural and manmade features. The selection represents a range of originators, ground condition dates, scales, and map purposes.
